summary: SKPM Technical Services Management Software - a full-featured field service management app with dashboard, job management, CRM, invoicing, scheduling, inventory, and more, built with realistic mock data based on the reference site skpmtecnicalservises.base44.app.
architectural_notes: Reference site: skpmtecnicalservises.base44.app — replicate all features with realistic mock data
App type: Field/Technical Services Management Software
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Professional technical services company logo with stylized wrench-and-gear icon, bold sans-serif text 'SKPM' in white on a deep navy background with amber accent (skpm-logo.dim_200x60.png)

existing_features.title: Create a main Dashboard page displaying key performance indicators and overview stats: total open jobs, completed jobs today, pending invoices, total revenue this month, technician utilization rate, and recent activity feed. Use card-based KPI widgets and a summary chart showing job status distribution.

Implement a Job / Work Order management module. Users can create new jobs with fields: job title, description, customer, assigned technician, priority (Low/Medium/High/Urgent), status (New/In Progress/On Hold/Completed/Cancelled), scheduled date, location/address, and notes. Support listing all jobs with filters by status, priority, technician, and date range. Allow editing and deleting jobs.

Build a CRM (Customer/Client Management) module. Each customer record includes: name, company, email, phone, address, customer type (Residential/Commercial), notes, and job history. Support creating, editing, deleting, and searching customers. Show a customer detail page with linked jobs and invoices.

Create an Invoicing and Billing module. Invoices link to a customer and optionally to a job. Invoice fields: invoice number (auto-generated), customer, linked job (optional), issue date, due date, line items (description, quantity, unit price), subtotal, tax rate, total, payment status (Unpaid/Partial/Paid/Overdue), and notes. Support creating, editing, marking as paid, and listing invoices with filters by status and customer.

Implement a Scheduling and Calendar module. Display a calendar view (monthly and weekly) showing scheduled jobs and technician assignments. Allow dragging or selecting a date to schedule a job. Show technician availability and assigned jobs per day. Support viewing all scheduled jobs in a list view as well.

Build an Inventory / Parts & Stock Management module. Each inventory item has: item name, SKU/part number, category, quantity in stock, minimum stock threshold, unit cost, supplier, and notes. Support adding, editing, and removing items. Display low-stock alerts for items below the minimum threshold. Allow recording stock usage against a job.

Create a Technician / Staff Management module. Each technician record includes: name, email, phone, specialization/skills, status (Active/Inactive), assigned jobs count, and notes. Support creating, editing, and deactivating technicians. Show a technician detail page with their assigned job history.

Implement a Reports and Analytics module with the following pre-built reports: (1) Jobs Summary — total jobs by status and technician over a selectable date range; (2) Revenue Report — total invoiced and collected amounts by month; (3) Technician Performance — completed jobs and average completion time per technician; (4) Inventory Usage — top parts consumed over a period. Display data in tables with simple bar or line charts.

Design a professional field-service management visual theme: a deep navy and steel-gray sidebar navigation with amber/orange accent colors for primary actions and status highlights. Use clean card-based layouts with subtle shadows, a compact data-table style for list views, and a left-sidebar navigation linking to all modules (Dashboard, Jobs, Customers, Invoices, Schedule, Inventory, Technicians, Reports). Apply this theme consistently across all pages.
Generate and render a custom app logo for SKPM Technical Services displayed in the top of the sidebar navigation, using the generated image as a static asset from frontend/public/assets/generated.

new_feature_requests.summary: Dashboard with overview stats and KPIs
Job/work order management (create, assign, track jobs)

Populate the application with realistic mock seed data on first load: at least 10 customers, 5 technicians, 20 jobs in various statuses, 15 invoices, 30 inventory items, and scheduled events spanning the current month. This data should be inserted into the backend on initialization if no records exist.
